name: webappfind
title: webappfind
author: Brett Zamir
description: Enables an experimental protocol system for allowing the user to supply local files for viewing and editing by web applications

scripts.build-installer-all: npm run build-native-apps-all && npm run build-installer-component-all && npm link
scripts.installer-all: npm run build-installer-all && npm run run-install
scripts.build-installer: npm run build-native-apps && npm run build-installer-component && npm link
scripts.installer: npm run build-installer && npm run run-install
scripts.webext-lint: web-ext lint --ignore-files ignore/ bin/ *.md src/ native-app.js filetypes.json package.json copy-polyfill.js
scripts.webext-run: web-ext run --ignore-files ignore/ bin/ *.md src/ native-app.js filetypes.json package.json copy-polyfill.js
scripts.webext-build: web-ext build --ignore-files ignore/ bin/ *.md src/ native-app.js filetypes.json package.json copy-polyfill.js
scripts.lint: npm run eslint && npm run copy-polyfill && npm run webext-lint
scripts.run: npm run eslint && npm run copy-polyfill && npm run webext-run
scripts.addon: npm run eslint && npm run copy-polyfill && npm run webext-build
scripts.installer-lint: npm run installer && npm run lint
scripts.installer-run: npm run installer && npm run run
scripts.installer-addon: npm run installer && npm run addon
scripts.installer-all-lint: npm run installer-all && npm run lint
scripts.installer-all-run: npm run installer-all && npm run run
scripts.installer-all-addon: npm run installer-all && npm run addon

preferences.description: In order to confine approved web apps from having no more access than they need in order to conduct the approved operations on the specified file, the default behavior is not to send the genuine file path of a selected file to scripts. If you are not concerned with the privacy of your file paths, you can enable this option (e.g., so that your file viewing program can display the current path for you).
preferences.name: revealFilePaths
preferences.title: Reveal selected file paths to scripts

preferences.description: When the selected file does not find a handler according to your configuration, display the errors.
preferences.name: displayErrors
preferences.title: Display errors

preferences.description: When a file is matched to a file type, but no protocol is yet registered for the type, visit the registration page designated within the selected file's directory (if present) to give that site a chance to inform you of the protocols and let you choose one if you so decide.
preferences.name: noProtocolFallbackToRegistrationMode
preferences.title: No registered protocol for detected type: Fallback to registration mode (if present)

preferences.description: When a file is matched to a file type, but no protocol is yet registered for the type nor is a registration page designated within the selected file's directory or one is not allowed, fall back to the directory's designated default handlers.
preferences.name: noProtocolFallbackToDefaultHandlers
preferences.title: No registered protocol for detected type (nor registration mode): Fallback to designated default handlers (if present)

preferences.description: When a file is matched to a file type, but no protocol is yet registered for the type nor is a registration page designated within the selected file's directory or one is not allowed, nor are default handlers allowed or present, try to fall back to the directory's file hierarchy.
preferences.name: noProtocolFallbackToHierarchy
preferences.title: No registered protocol for detected type (nor matched registration mode or default handlers): Fallback to the directory's file hierarchy (if present)

preferences.description: When a file type is not detected (or no matches for it are found), try using the file's extension within a web protocol (e.g., if the data file ends with '.js' then look for a web protocol to handle 'js' files).
preferences.name: fallbackToWebProtocolUsingFileExtension
preferences.title: Fallback to web protocol using file extension (if present)

preferences.description: When a file type is not detected (or no matches for it are found) and if file-extension based web protocol fallbacks are not permitted by you or are not found, open the file in the browser (e.g., if the data file ends with '.js' but no subtype or handler is found for this file then open the JavaScript file in the browser).
preferences.name: fallbackToBrowserUsingFilePath
preferences.title: Fallback to browser opening the file

preferences.description: When a file type is not detected  (or no matches for it are found) and if file-extension based web protocol fallbacks are not permitted by you or are not found nor did you permit the browser to open the file, launch the file from the desktop (e.g., if the data file ends with '.js' but no subtype or handler is found for this file then open the JavaScript file according to your operating system's desktop).
preferences.name: fallbackToDesktopUsingFilePath
preferences.title: Fallback to desktop opening the file
